This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
if(!file.exists("data"))  {
	dir.create("data")
}

setwd("./data")

if(!file.exists("repdatadataactivity.zip"))  {
	zipFileUrl <- "https://d396qusza40orc.cloudfront.net/repdata%2Fdata%2Factivity.zip?accessType=DOWNLOAD"
	download.file(zipFileUrl, destfile="repdatadataactivity.zip")
}

if(!file.exists("activity.csv")) {
	## check and correct the code to unzip
	unzip("./repdatadataactivity.zip", list=FALSE, overwrite=TRUE, exdir=".")
}

activitydata <- read.csv("activity.csv")

```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
## Group by the day and then total the steps
	act_group <- group_by(activitydata, date)
	act_by_date <- summarize(act_group, sum(steps))
	colnames(act_by_date )[2] <- "TotalSteps"

## Plot the Graph (Base Plotting System)
	hist(act_by_date$TotalSteps, 
				xlab="Total Number of Steps", ylab="Total Steps",
				main="Histogram of Total Number of Steps taken each Day")

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
